Posts.Content: gofish185 wrote: I am a premenopausal,Â 45 year old, had a lumpectomy and SN removal. Stage 2, N1mic (micromet), ER/PR+, HER2/neu neg. 2.2 mm tumor, grade 3. Just had the Oncotype DX test to predict distant recurrance even though I am technically node positive. My results came back a zero, both on the node neg. graph, and on the postmenopausal node postive graph. Doctors and I are unsure how to proceed given the test would indicate no chemo. Anyone had a similar result?? Any advice or info. would be great! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Oncotype DX gofish185 hlya

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2010 04:16PM gofish185 wrote: Hi Patty The surgeon will have preliminary results for you after surgery, but the results may change after the final pathology is done. Initially, my results were clean, but then one node was positive. Good luck, I know you will do fine!
Posts.Title: surgery lymph nodes pattyb5 fg2000

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2010 08:01PM gofish185 wrote: Your cousins dx is the same as mine. I had a lumpectomy Mar. 12th. Drs. initially advised me to have ac and t, rads, and tamoxifan. Just received my oncotype dx results and scored a ZERO for distant recurrance. Now none of the Drs. or I know what to do. The test indicates no chemo but tumor grade and age say chemo. What a decision. Has your cousin been offered this test, it may help with her decision on chemo and what drugs. If anyone has had a similar situation please let me know. Good luck to you both!
Posts.Title: Stage 2a needs help with chemo decision pennylane DiDel
